title: Layer of Let's Go Biking in O.C.
name: Layer of Let's Go Biking in O.C.

properties.name: El Moro Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Baostar    8471 N Coast Hwy, Laguna Beach, CAThis park contains lush, sycamore-shaded canyons and high ridges offering views of the Pacific Ocean which create a spectacular environment for hiking, mountain biking and horseback riding. Designed to preserve the delicate balance of the natural habitat, a major portion of the park\'s 3,200 acres is open for use on a limited basis.

properties.name: Harvard Spine Bike Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar    This bike trail runs through the Edible Landscape Park, which helps Second Harvest Food Bank provide for more than 200,000 people every month. More than 80 citrus trees of various types have been planted in this unique garden.

properties.name: Hicks Canyon Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   This trail is right outside of the private residental community where I live. It is accessible from the inside along the corridors, as well as from the outside at Hicks Canyon Park or Citrusglen Park. The original trail was the road from nowhere to nowhere through orange groves (since replaced by houses) and is a favorite jogging trail of many local residents. This may be the least noisy trail in town with few busy streets (and none that you have to cross) and no freeways nearby. Pungent eucalyptus trees line most of the trail and provide shade in the afternoon.

properties.name: Marina Hills/Chapparosa Park path
properties.description: Posted by Nealee  Also connected to the Salt Creek Corridor path that takes you straight to the beach.

properties.name: Newport Beach Bike & Skate Rental
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   2200 W. Oceanfront, Newport Beach, CA

properties.name: Salt Creek Corridor
properties.description: Posted by Nealee Starts next to Niguel road and goes straight to Salt Creek Beach but many people park along Camino del Avion where there is access to the path which continues underneath the road. This path is also connected to Marina Hills path/Chaprosa path but it doesnt show on the map.

properties.name: San Clemente Beach Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar    This recently opened, 2.3-mile trail spans from North Beach to Calafia Beach. You can stroll along the crashing sound of waves filling the air. The scenery offers a vision of what Southern California is all about - surfers catching waves on a day with a decent swell, sea gulls gather on the sand, and families simply out enjoying a day at the beach.

properties.name: Santa Ana River Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  , , CAThe Santa Ana River trail starts near the Prado Dam (Corona) and heads 30 miles south to the Pacific Ocean eventually joining up with the Huntington Beach and Newport / Balboa bike trails. The north end of the trail passes through several scenic parks. The middle part of the trail has some nice tree lined sections and small parks. Continuing southward, the trail passes the Anaheim Stadium and a large golf course in the middle of the Santa Ana river bed. Further to the south, the trail enters an industrial area and finally reaches the ocean.

properties.name: Sunset Beach to Newport Beach
properties.description: Posted by Baostar   Sunset Beach, CAOrange County is blessed with more than 40 miles of some of the prettiest coastline in the country. What better way to see it than by taking a leisurely bike ride? The wide, paved bicycle path runs from Sunset Beach in the north, through Huntington Beach, and into Newport and Balboa Beach to the south. Although it\'s a 15-mile trip each way, most cyclists just go part of the way, stopping frequently to watch the surfers, have a snack at a beachside food stand, or to enjoy the gorgeous view of the Pacific Ocean. Summer weekends are especially busy, when the bike paths are shared by bicyclists, inline skaters, and people jogging or walking.

properties.name: The Mountains To Sea Trail
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  The 22-mile bike path begins at Weir Canyon in Anaheim Hills and meanders through Orange, Tustin, and Irvine, ultimately ending up in Newport Beach\'s Back Bay. The picturesque bikeway passes through some of the most natural areas remaining in the county, providing glimpses of thick eucalyptus groves, a wildlife sanctuary, and a variety of native vegetation.

properties.name: Wheel Fun Rentals
properties.description: Posted by Baostar  25300 Dana Point Harbor Dr. , Dana Point, CA(949)496-7433

properties.name: Zack’s Beach Catering and Concessions
properties.description: Posted by Baostar    Main St & Pacific Coast Highway, Huntington Beach, CAZack\'s is the closest concession to the Huntington Beach Pier, free outdoor concerts, US Open of Surfing and other exciting Huntington Beach events.
